Module Cryptography
Package cryptography.cracking

Class Candidate

java.lang.Object
cryptography.cracking.Candidate
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Candidate>
public class Candidate
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Candidate>
This class represents a solution for a cracked cipher. Each candidate is made up of the decoded message and an error count, which is used to estimate the semantic correctness of the message. This class also implements the Comparable interface, which sorts a number of candidates in descending order, according to the number of errors.

    • getText

      public java.lang.String getText()
      Retrieves the text of this candidate.
      Returns:
      the text of this candidate

    • setText

      public void setText​(java.lang.String text)
      Sets the decoded text of this candidate.
      Parameters:
      text - The decoded text of this candidate

    • getErrors

      public int getErrors()
      Retrieves the number of semantic errors of this candidate. Note that this method does not, by itself, evaluate this candidate's text's correctness. To do so, use the estimateErrors( SpellChecker spellChecker) method.
      Returns:
      The number of errors of this candidate.

    • estimatedErrors

      public int estimatedErrors​(SpellChecker spellChecker)
      Uses the given SpellChecker to estimate this candidate's text's semantic errors.
      Parameters:
      spellChecker - The spell checker that holds the evaluation criteria
      Returns:
      The estimated number of mistakes

    • estimatedErrors

      public int estimatedErrors()
      Estimates this candidate's text's semantic errors. This method delegates to: estimatedErrors(new SpellChecker).
      Returns:
      The estimated number of mistakes

    • addErrors

      public void addErrors​(int errors)
      Increases the number of errors by the given number.
      Parameters:
      errors - The errors to add

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Candidate c)
      Compares the given candidate to this one. This method subtracts the given candidate's errors from this candidate's errors in order to sort them in descending order.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Candidate>
      Parameters:
      c - The candidate to compare
      Returns:
      this.getErrors() - c.getErrors()

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Converts this candidate to a String. This method is equal to: this.getText() + "; " + this.getErrors()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      This candidate as a String
